text:
Hi there! I’m new to this channel and I have a question. I have set up a blog in HubSpot and I want to add a Facebook feed to the blog. So I opened the official Facebook developer website: <https://developers.facebook.com/docs/plugins/page-plugin/>. I exactly did what they said. I included the JavaScript SDK on my page once (in the header of the template in blog settings), and I made a custom module an added the code <http://developers.facebook.com|developers.facebook.com> gave me.
Sometimes the Facebook feed shows perfectly, sometimes it shows 1 line with text and sometimes it shows an network error, when I refresh the page. See images below:
Could anyone help me with this issue? Did I add the codes to the right places?
Dont’ async/defer your code, it is likely loading after your other scripts that are trying to bring in the content.
without seeing your live page and being able to inspect the console on the error, I am pretty sure this is what happeneinng
if you want to share the url I can attempt to replicate the issue and dig more

Has anyone tried using the CMI to use Local Developer Tools with multiple access tokens? I set one up for my sandbox, and now I want to set up another one, but when I try to input my accesskey after `hs auth`  steps, it throws errors and won't let me continue through to adding more than one accesskey on my local dev.

I figured it out. I was not able (for some reason) to paste my accesskey. What's weird is that I was able to paste it in the command tool, but not at the step where it was requesting the key. So I had to manually type the accesskey. I actually did this before I reached out, but I must have accidentally mistyped something (which is really easy to do in that long string!).
